title: Analysis of Sociodemographic Influences on Cognitive Function and Academic Achievement in Children with Epilepsy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic neuroscience, cognitive psychology, and sociodemographic research methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners analyze the impact of sociodemographic factors on the cognitive and academic development of children with epilepsy through live lectures, discussion sessions, and online resource sharing.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of sociodemographic disadvantages on the cognitive functioning of children with epilepsy based on 36-month longitudinal study data.
Learners can analyze the correlation between neuropsychological assessment metrics (language, memory, processing speed, etc.) and academic achievement.
Learners can propose a research design to evaluate the influence of sociodemographic indicators (income, education level, etc.) on cognitive development trajectories.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
